fields.name: categories

fields.description: Query individual category

fields.description: List all channels

types.name: Category
types.description: Categories are the containers for live streaming content.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the category

fields.name: slug
fields.description: Slug of the category

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: NaiveDateTime
types.description:
The `Naive DateTime` scalar type represents a naive date and time without
timezone. The DateTime appears in a JSON response as an ISO8601 formatted
string.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Subcategory
types.description: Subcategories are specific games, topics, or genre's that exist under a Category.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the subcategory

fields.name: slug
fields.description: URL friendly name of the subcategory

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: When paginating forwards, the cursor to continue.

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: When paginating forwards, are there more items?

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: When paginating backwards, are there more items?

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: When paginating backwards, the cursor to continue.

types.name: Tag
types.description: Tags are user created labels that are either global or category specific.

fields.name: countUsage
fields.description: The number of streams started with this tag

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the tag

fields.name: slug
fields.description: URL friendly name of the tag

types.name: Channel
types.description: A channel is a user's actual container for live streaming.

fields.name: blockLinks
fields.description: Toggle for blocking anyone from posting links

fields.name: disableHyperlinks
fields.description: Toggle for links automatically being clickable

fields.name: language
fields.description: The language a user can expect in the stream

fields.name: matureContent
fields.description: If the streamer has flagged this channel as only appropriate for Mature Audiences

fields.name: minimumAccountAge
fields.description: Minimum account age length before chatting

fields.name: requireConfirmedEmail
fields.description: Toggle for requiring confirmed email before chatting

fields.name: showOnHomepage
fields.description: Toggle for homepage visibility

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current status of the channnel

fields.name: stream
fields.description: If the channel is live, this will be the current Stream

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the channel

types.name: ChannelBan
types.description: A channel timeout or ban

types.name: User
types.description: A user of Glimesh, can be a streamer, a viewer or both!

fields.name: avatarUrl
fields.description: URL to the user's avatar

fields.name: channel
fields.description: A user's channel, if they have one

fields.name: confirmedAt
fields.description: Datetime the user confirmed their email address

fields.name: displayname
fields.description: Exactly the same as the username, but with casing the user prefers

fields.name: email
fields.description: Email for the user, hidden behind a scope

fields.name: followingLiveChannels
fields.description: Shortcut to a user's followed channels

fields.name: insertedAt
fields.description: Account creation date

fields.name: profileContentHtml
fields.description: HTML version of the user's profile, should be safe for rendering directly

fields.name: profileContentMd
fields.description: Markdown version of the user's profile

fields.name: socialDiscord
fields.description: Qualified URL for the user's Discord server

fields.name: socialGuilded
fields.description: Qualified URL for the user's Guilded server

fields.name: socialInstagram
fields.description: Qualified URL for the user's Instagram account

fields.name: socialYoutube
fields.description: Qualified URL for the user's YouTube account

fields.name: socials
fields.description: A list of linked social accounts for the user

fields.name: teamRole
fields.description: The primary role the user performs on the Glimesh team

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: Account last updated date

fields.name: username
fields.description: Lowercase user identifier

fields.name: youtubeIntroUrl
fields.description: YouTube Intro URL for the user's profile

types.name: Follower
types.description: A follower is a user who subscribes to notifications for a particular user's channel.

types.name: UserSocial
types.description: A linked social account for a Glimesh user.

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: Platform unique identifier, usually a ID, made into a string

fields.name: platform
fields.description: Platform that is linked, eg: twitter

fields.name: username
fields.description: Username for the user on the linked platform

types.name: ChatMessage
types.description: A chat message sent to a channel by a user.

fields.name: isFollowedMessage
fields.description: Was this message generated by our system for a follow
fields.deprecationReason: We're going to replace this shortly after launch

fields.name: isSubscriptionMessage
fields.description: Was this message generated by our system for a subscription
fields.deprecationReason: We're going to replace this shortly after launch

fields.name: message
fields.description: The chat message contents, be careful to sanitize because any user input is allowed

types.name: ChannelModerationLog
types.description: A moderation event that happened

types.name: ChannelModerator
types.description: A channel moderator

types.name: Stream
types.description: A stream is a single live stream in, either current or historical.

fields.name: countViewers
fields.description: Concurrent viewers during last snapshot

fields.name: endedAt
fields.description: Datetime of when the stream was ended, or null if still going

fields.name: peakViewers
fields.description: Peak concurrent viewers

fields.name: startedAt
fields.description: Datetime of when the stream was started

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the channel when the stream was started

types.name: StreamMetadata
types.description: A single instance of stream metadata.

fields.name: banUser
fields.description: Ban a user from a chat channel.

fields.name: createChatMessage
fields.description: Create a chat message

fields.name: deleteChatMessage
fields.description: Deletes a specific chat message from channel.

fields.name: endStream
fields.description: End a stream

fields.name: logStreamMetadata
fields.description: Update a stream's metadata

fields.name: longTimeoutUser
fields.description: Long timeout (15 minutes) a user from a chat channel.

fields.name: shortTimeoutUser
fields.description: Short timeout (5 minutes) a user from a chat channel.

fields.name: startStream
fields.description: Start a stream

fields.name: unbanUser
fields.description: Unban a user from a chat channel.

fields.name: uploadStreamThumbnail
fields.description: Update a stream's thumbnail

types.name: Upload
types.description: Represents an uploaded file.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.
